decks.notes: The main concept of this Control - Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's plays through hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil. It also aims to generate card advantage with cards like Graveyard Trespasser and generate value from its creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Gifted Aetherborn. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent by controlling the game and making efficient plays.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The strategy involves using efficient low-cost creatures such as Emberheart Challenger and Kumano Faces Kakkazan to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total, while utilizing burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike to finish them off. The deck aims to maintain a fast tempo and apply constant pressure to disrupt the opponent's game plan, ultimately securing a quick victory through aggressive plays and direct damage.

The deck focuses on quickly getting Arclight Phoenix into play and using spells to trigger its ability to return from the graveyard. It includes a mix of card draw, burn spells, and control elements to support the aggro strategy. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast creatures and efficient removal, taking advantage of the Phoenix's ability to generate card advantage and pressure the opponent. Timing and sequencing spells correctly is crucial to maximizing the deck's potential and closing out the game quickly.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with removal spells like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Go for the Throat, while also applying pressure with creatures like Gifted Aetherborn and Graveyard Trespasser. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and control the board with cards like Liliana of the Veil and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. By utilizing a mix of disruption, removal, and card advantage, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a grindy matchup.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly bring your opponent's life total to zero. The key strategy is to play efficient creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear early in the game, followed by powerful burn spells like Burst Lightning and Play with Fire to finish off your opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Monstrous Rage to deal large amounts of damage in a single turn, putting pressure on your opponent to keep up. The mana base is designed to support a fast and aggressive playstyle.

This aggressive red deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with fast creatures and burn spells. Cards like Manifold Mouse and Screaming Nemesis can deal damage early on, while Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Burst Lightning provide flexibility in removing threats. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Hazoret the Fervent and Sunspine Lynx to secure victory. With a mix of direct damage, creature pressure, and a few utility lands like Mutavault and Ramunap Ruins, this deck is designed to apply constant pressure and close out games quickly.

The main idea of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with aggressive creatures like Bishop of Wings, Resplendent Angel, and Skyclave Apparition, while also generating value with cards like Collected Company. The deck aims to apply early pressure and outpace opponents with efficient creatures, backed up by mana acceleration from cards like Llanowar Elves and Elvish Mystic. The inclusion of cards like Righteous Valkyrie and Giada, Font of Hope further enhances the deck's aggro strategy by capitalizing on life gain synergies to snowball into a dominant position.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy, stall the game, and ultimately grind out a win through card advantage and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. Additionally, the deck utilizes its companion, Kaheera, the Orphanguard, to provide a slight tribal synergy and additional value. The deck's strategy revolves around controlling the board, managing resources, and outlasting the opponent in a battle of attrition.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with cheap creatures like Novice Inspector and Thraben Inspector, then buffing them with Venerated Loxodon and Warden of the Inner Sky for a fast, aggressive playstyle. The deck also includes removal options like Gleeful Demolition and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance to deal with opposing threats. With a strong mana base and a mix of creatures and spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of speed and power.

This deck focuses on using Enigmatic Incarnation to tutor for powerful creatures and control the board. By utilizing a variety of powerful creatures and versatile lands, the deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol opponents in the Pioneer format. The inclusion of companion Yorion, Sky Nomad adds an extra layer of synergy and value to the deck. The key strategy is to maintain board presence, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and overwhelm them with a variety of threats. Ultimately, the deck aims to dominate the game through efficient resource management and strategic decision-making.

This deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field as a key component to generate a large amount of mana quickly. By combining cards like Hidden Strings, Thespian's Stage, and Vizier of Tumbling Sands, the deck aims to create powerful mana engines and cast powerful spells such as Omniscience and Emergent Ultimatum. The inclusion of Pore Over the Pages and Dark Petition help with card draw and tutoring for key pieces of the combo. Strict Proctor and Spara's Headquarters provide disruption against opponent's strategies, while Bala Ged Recovery and Lush Portico offer recursion and additional utility.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counter spells, board wipes, and card advantage to outlast the opponent. The key strategy is to maintain a strong defensive position while gradually drawing out the game in order to overwhelm the opponent with powerful late-game threats. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by blinking creatures and permanents for extra card advantage. With a mixture of removal, card draw, and powerful finishers, this deck aims to grind out victories through patient and strategic play.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Kroxa. It also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to control the board. The deck includes powerful late-game threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance to close out the game. The deck aims to be fast and efficient in dealing damage to the opponent while maintaining control with a mix of disruption and removal spells.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Greasefang and Parhelion II to create a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent. It includes cards that help protect the combo pieces, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and generate card advantage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the strategy while ensuring consistency in casting spells. The deck aims to quickly establish control of the game and maintain pressure on the opponent until victory is achieved.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of attacks. It combines burn spells for removal and card draw to maintain a steady flow of spells. The key strategy is to efficiently use instants and sorceries to enable the Phoenix's recursion while tempoing the opponent with aggressive creatures. Additionally, the deck includes versatile cards like Picklock Prankster and Profit's Eidetic Memory to disrupt opponents and gain advantages. Overall, the deck aims to maintain pressure and control the game with a mix of aggression and spellcasting.

The deck focuses on aggressively playing creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan through discard spells. It utilizes a mix of high-impact threats like Sheoldred and Kroxa, along with efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The deck aims to apply pressure early with creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Mutavault, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with thoughseize and Duress. The inclusion of cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Raucous Theater help provide additional reach and card advantage to close out games quickly.
